DOC.brief_title: Computer-Assisted Scheduling Nicotine Inhaler Use Participants Who Plan Stop Smoking
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine effect program length inhaler use compliance , latency smoking relapse , gradual cessation inhaler use participant use computer-assisted program schedule nicotine inhaler dose smoke cessation . II . Compare fast slow paced version computer-assisted schedule nicotine inhaler use versus ad libitum nicotine inhaler use , term smoke cessation rate , participant . III . Compare dose condition , term adherence , initial dosing level , successful tapering effect , participant . OUTLINE : This randomize study . Participants randomize one three arm . All participant monitor period cigarette smoke 7 day press data input button hand-held computer every time smoke . Arm I : Participants begin use nicotine inhaler accord dose instruction come monitor inhaler usage hand-held computer . Arm II : Participants prompt hand-held computer use nicotine inhaler base prior smoke habit . When prompt , participant use nicotine inhaler comfortable rate 20 minute . The computer prompt participant fixed frequency duration inhaler use 3 week taper frequency duration 3-5 week . Arm III : Participants prompt hand-held computer use nicotine inhaler arm II . The computer prompt participant fixed frequency duration inhaler use 12 week taper frequency duration 3-5 week . Participants keep weekly diary average number cigarette smoke , average number inhaler session , average length session . Participants also record date 24-hour smoking cessation relapse complete withdrawal symptom questionnaire . Participants follow 1 year . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 480 participant accrue study .
